channel.title: Male RCA to Female 3.5mm/idk
channel.description: My tv speakers are pretty much broken. I have no idea what happened to them but after a while like a staticy crackling sound starting coming out all the time unless the audio was muted. Now it just plays a sort of medium pitched buz. I was trying to figure out a way to get audio from my ps to go out speakers. I have two speakers connected on AV OUT but no sound will come out of them so I was thinking, could I use a Male RCA to female 3.5mm to connect the AV OUT to a set of PC speakers and play the audio that way or could I get a female RCA to female 3.5mm(if thats possible) and directly connect the ps3 audio to the PC speakers?

item.title: Male RCA to Female 3.5mm/idk
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

sp11k3t3ht3rd:

My tv doesn’t have a headphone jack. It’s wicked dumb because I can’t even get replacement parts for the tv and it’s out of warranty by now. I’m just going to buy a new tv…

You said you had AV out, that’s close enough. Any form of audio out will do, though you may need some cheap adapters and shizz.

Read full topic

item.title: Male RCA to Female 3.5mm/idk
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

I use one of these with my 5.1 surround speakers:

amazon.co.uk

TRIXES External Sound Card USB 6 Channel 5.1 Audio: Amazon.co.uk: Computers & Accessories

This external sound card offers a quality solution for upgrading you PC or laptop audio. Features This device supports 32 KHz, 44.1 KHz and 48 KHz sampling rate in digital and analog recording, and in ...

£10.99

Works well, just plug a 3.5mm male to male jack from headphones slot in tv to line in on sound card.

Read full topic
